ReaderFactory.file_description: PVGP Unifrom Grid Reader. Opens a header file which points to data arrays to fill a uniform grid.

IntVectorProperty.name: OutputDataSetType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property determines the dataset type for the output of the programmable filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileNames
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The list of files to be read by the reader.

ReaderFactory.file_description: PVGP Unifrom Grid Reader. Opens a header file which points to data arrays to fill a uniform grid.

StringVectorProperty.name: Script
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the text of a python program that the programmable source runs.

StringVectorProperty.name: InformationScript
StringVectorProperty.label: RequestInformation Script
StringVectorProperty.default_values: from paraview import util from PVGPpy.read import setOutputTimesteps, readPVGPGridExtents # This is necessary to set time steps setOutputTimesteps(self, FileNames[0], dt=Time_Step) # NOTE: if using time series, they all must have the same extents ext = readPVGPGridExtents(FileNames[0]) util.SetOutputWholeExtent(self, ext)
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property is a python script that is executed during the RequestInformation pipeline pass. Use this to provide information such as WHOLE_EXTENT to the pipeline downstream.

StringVectorProperty.name: PythonPath
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: A semi-colon (;) separated list of directories to add to the python library search path.

SourceProxy.name: ReadDelimitedTextFileToTable
SourceProxy.label: Read Delimited Text File To Table

Documentation.long_help: This reader will take in any delimited text file and make a vtkTable from it. This is not much different than the default .txt or .csv reader in Paraview, however it gives us room to use our own extensions and a little more flexibility in the structure of the files we import.
Documentation.short_help: This reader will take in any delimited text file and make a vtkTable from it. This is not much different than the default .txt or .csv reader in Paraview, however it gives us room to use our own extensions and a little more flexibility in the structure of the files we import.

IntVectorProperty.name: OutputDataSetType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property determines the dataset type for the output of the programmable filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileNames
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The list of files to be read by the reader.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Time_Step
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Time Step
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: An advanced property for the time step in seconds.

IntVectorProperty.name: Use_Tab_Delimiter
IntVectorProperty.label: Use Tab Delimiter
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: A boolean to override the Delimiter_Field and use Tab delimiter.

StringVectorProperty.name: Script
StringVectorProperty.default_values:
from PVGPpy.read import delimitedText, getTimeStepFileIndex
# This finds the index for the FileNames for the requested timestep i = getTimeStepFileIndex(self, FileNames, dt=Time_Step)
# Generate Output pdo = self.GetOutput() delimitedText(FileNames[i], deli=Delimiter_Field, useTab=Use_Tab_Delimiter, hasTits=Has_Titles, numIgLns=Number_Ignore_Lines, pdo=pdo)
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the text of a python program that the programmable source runs.

StringVectorProperty.name: InformationScript
StringVectorProperty.label: RequestInformation Script
StringVectorProperty.default_values: from PVGPpy.read import setOutputTimesteps # This is necessary to set time steps setOutputTimesteps(self, FileNames, dt=Time_Step)
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property is a python script that is executed during the RequestInformation pipeline pass. Use this to provide information such as WHOLE_EXTENT to the pipeline downstream.

StringVectorProperty.name: PythonPath
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: A semi-colon (;) separated list of directories to add to the python library search path.

SourceProxy.name: ReadPackedBinaryFileToTable
SourceProxy.label: Read Packed Binary File To Table

Documentation.long_help: This reads in float or double data that is packed into a binary file format. It will treat the data as one long array and make a vtkTable with one column of that data. The reader uses defaults to import as floats with native endianness. Use the Table to Uniform Grid or the Reshape Table filters to give more meaning to the data. We chose to use a vtkTable object as the output of this reader because it gives us more flexibility in the filters we can apply to this data down the pipeline and keeps thing simple when using filters in this repository.
Documentation.short_help: This reads in float or double data that is packed into a binary file format. It will treat the data as one long array and make a vtkTable with one column of that data. The reader uses defaults to import as floats with native endianness. Use the Table to Uniform Grid or the Reshape Table filters to give more meaning to the data. We chose to use a vtkTable object as the output of this reader because it gives us more flexibility in the filters we can apply to this data down the pipeline and keeps thing simple when using filters in this repository.

ReaderFactory.file_description: PVGP: Binary Packed Floats or Doubles

IntVectorProperty.name: OutputDataSetType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property determines the dataset type for the output of the programmable filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: Endianness
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This is the type memory endianness.

IntVectorProperty.name: DataType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This is data type to read.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileNames
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The list of files to be read by the reader.

ReaderFactory.file_description: PVGP: Binary Packed Floats or Doubles

StringVectorProperty.name: Data_Name
StringVectorProperty.label: Data Name
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The string name of the data array generated from the inut file.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Time_Step
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Time Step
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: An advanced property for the time step in seconds.

StringVectorProperty.name: Script
StringVectorProperty.default_values:
from PVGPpy.read import packedBinaries, getTimeStepFileIndex
# This finds the index for the FileNames for the requested timestep i = getTimeStepFileIndex(self, FileNames, dt=Time_Step) endi = ['@', '<', '>'] dtype = ['f', 'd', 'i']
# Generate Output pdo = self.GetOutput() packedBinaries(FileNames[i], dataNm=Data_Name, pdo=pdo, endian=endi[Endianness], dtype=dtype[DataType])
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the text of a python program that the programmable source runs.

StringVectorProperty.name: InformationScript
StringVectorProperty.label: RequestInformation Script
StringVectorProperty.default_values: from PVGPpy.read import setOutputTimesteps # This is necessary to set time steps setOutputTimesteps(self, FileNames, dt=Time_Step)
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property is a python script that is executed during the RequestInformation pipeline pass. Use this to provide information such as WHOLE_EXTENT to the pipeline downstream.

StringVectorProperty.name: PythonPath
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: A semi-colon (;) separated list of directories to add to the python library search path.

Documentation.long_help: This reads in float or double data that is packed into a Madagascar Single Stream RSF binary file format with a leader header. The reader ignores all of the ascii header details by searching for the sequence of three special characters: EOL EOL EOT ( ) and it will treat the following binary packed data as one long array and make a `vtkTable` with one column of that data. The reader defaults to import as floats with native endianness. Use the Table to Uniform Grid or the Reshape Table filters to give more meaning to the data. We will later implement the ability to create a gridded volume from the header info. We chose to use a vtkTable object as the output of this reader because it gives us more flexibility in the filters we can apply to this data down the pipeline and keeps thing simple when using filters in this repository. Details: http://www.ahay.org/wiki/RSF_Comprehensive_Description#Single-stream_RSF
Documentation.short_help: This reads in float or double data that is packed into a Madagascar Single Stream RSF binary file format with a leader header. The reader ignores all of the ascii header details by searching for the sequence of three special characters: EOL EOL EOT ( ) and it will treat the following binary packed data as one long array and make a `vtkTable` with one column of that data. The reader defaults to import as floats with native endianness. Use the Table to Uniform Grid or the Reshape Table filters to give more meaning to the data. We will later implement the ability to create a gridded volume from the header info. We chose to use a vtkTable object as the output of this reader because it gives us more flexibility in the filters we can apply to this data down the pipeline and keeps thing simple when using filters in this repository. Details: http://www.ahay.org/wiki/RSF_Comprehensive_Description#Single-stream_RSF

ReaderFactory.file_description: PVGP: Madagascar Single Stream RSF Format

IntVectorProperty.name: OutputDataSetType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property determines the dataset type for the output of the programmable filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: Endianness
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This is the type memory endianness.

IntVectorProperty.name: DataType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This is data type to read.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileNames
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The list of files to be read by the reader.

ReaderFactory.file_description: PVGP: Madagascar Single Stream RSF Format

StringVectorProperty.name: Data_Name
StringVectorProperty.label: Data Name
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The string name of the data array generated from the inut file.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Time_Step
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Time Step
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: An advanced property for the time step in seconds.

StringVectorProperty.name: Script
StringVectorProperty.default_values:
from PVGPpy.read import madagascar, getTimeStepFileIndex
# This finds the index for the FileNames for the requested timestep i = getTimeStepFileIndex(self, FileNames, dt=Time_Step) endi = ['@', '<', '>'] dtype = ['f', 'd', 'i']
# Generate Output pdo = self.GetOutput() madagascar(FileNames[i], dataNm=Data_Name, pdo=pdo, endian=endi[Endianness], dtype=dtype[DataType])

StringVectorProperty.default_values: from PVGPpy.read import setOutputTimesteps # This is necessary to set time steps setOutputTimesteps(self, FileNames, dt=Time_Step)
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property is a python script that is executed during the RequestInformation pipeline pass. Use this to provide information such as WHOLE_EXTENT to the pipeline downstream.

StringVectorProperty.name: PythonPath
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: A semi-colon (;) separated list of directories to add to the python library search path.
